title: Mitch212
author: Mitch212
content: Hello everyone,I'm from Lebanon and I was thinking to start mining, I know ETH is switching soon to POS but it would still be worth it to mine ETC and Raven? Here we got a huge electricity outage, so I was thinking to install solar panels and inverters just for the mining rig, what do you suggest me?On top of that would you recommend me to go with GPUs or an ASIIC thank you for taking time reading this

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I don't know what is current electricity rate in your country but if you are living in an area with very cheap electricity then it would be a good choice if you buy ASIC units except if your current electricity rate is above $0.15. ASIC units are power-hungry compared to GPU mining. So it depends on your current location if you have a cheap electricity rate.If you already decided to buy ASIC there are some cheap offers from Canaan here https://shop.canaan.io

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Mitch212 on September 05, 2022, 12:53:55 PMOn top of that would you recommend me to go with GPUs or an ASIIC I don't know how you plan your setup, but it may worth keeping in mind that ASICs are very noisy devices.So if you plan to do this at "home" scale, and actually at home, ASIC may be a problematic choice.On the altcoins mining part I cannot advise, that you may want to ask in altcoin mining sub.

comments.author: TreyARC
comments.body: The merge is almost here, anyone planning to build a mining rig right should stop and wait for few more days, you will be able to adjust your plans if needed, don't go and buy something that you will later regret, you should build your rig according to the results after the merge.

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: The sun doesn't shine 24 hours per day, even in the desert. ROI is automatically more double on the mining equipment, not including the costto build the solar array.
